etymology.description: Simplified from 員 (yuán, "member") by replacing 貝(貝) (bèi, "cowry") with 贝(贝) (bèi, "cowry shell")
etymology.interpretation: The simplification replaced the complex 貝(貝) (bèi, "cowry") component with its simpler form 贝(贝) (bèi, "cowry shell") to create a more efficient character for modern writing.
etymology.simplification: 員(員) simplified by replacing the 貝(貝) component with 贝(贝), a reflection of reducing strokes while maintaining the original meaning.

examples.chinese: 我是团队的一员(我是團隊的一員)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ shì tuánduì de yī yuán.
examples.english: I am a member of the team.

examples.chinese: 他加入社团(他加入社團)，成为其中一员(成為其中一員)。
examples.pinyin: Tā jiārù shètuán, chéngwéi qízhōng yī yuán.
examples.english: He joined the club and became one of its members.

examples.chinese: 会议上(會議上)，每位员都有发言权(每位員都有發言權)。
examples.pinyin: Huìyì shàng, měi wèi yuán dōu yǒu fāyánquán.
examples.english: At the meeting, every member had the right to speak.
